intro: Galium subvelutinum subsp. megalanthum, commonly known as the giant bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a soft, velvety appearance. Galium subvelutinum subsp. megalanthum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
